skill.name: frontend-design
skill.description: Create distinctive, production-grade frontend interfaces with high design quality. Use this skill when the user asks to build web components, pages, or applications. Generates creative, polished code that avoids generic AI aesthetics.
skill.summary: Create distinctive, production-grade frontend interfaces with high design quality. Use this skill wh...
skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: OFFICIAL skill from Anthropic containing only design guidance and best practices. No code execution, file system access, or external network calls - purely instructional content.

content.value_statement: Creates production-ready, visually distinctive web interfaces with bold aesthetic choices that stand out from generic AI-generated designs.
actual_capabilities: Generate production-grade HTML/CSS/JS, React, or Vue code
Create distinctive, memorable aesthetic directions for web interfaces
Design bold typography systems with unique font pairings
Implement cohesive color schemes using CSS variables
Build sophisticated CSS animations and micro-interactions
Create unexpected layouts with asymmetry and spatial creativity
Design atmospheric backgrounds with textures, gradients, and visual effects
Match implementation complexity to aesthetic vision (minimalist to maximalist)
Avoid generic AI aesthetics and cookie-cutter patterns
limitations: Requires clear context about purpose, audience, and technical constraints for best results
Does not include backend functionality or data integration
Focuses on visual/aesthetic implementation rather than business logic
May require manual refinement for specific framework versions or tooling
Custom font choices may require additional licensing or hosting setup

use_cases.title: Landing Page Design
use_cases.description: Create a bold, memorable landing page that captures attention and communicates brand identity through distinctive typography, color, and motion design
use_cases.target_user: Startup founders, marketing teams, and web designers launching new products or services

use_cases.title: Component Library Creation
use_cases.description: Build a cohesive set of UI components with a unique aesthetic direction that differentiates your product from competitors
use_cases.target_user: Frontend developers and design systems teams establishing brand identity

use_cases.title: Portfolio Website
use_cases.description: Design a visually striking portfolio that showcases creative work with unexpected layouts, sophisticated animations, and memorable visual details
use_cases.target_user: Designers, artists, and creative professionals seeking to stand out

use_cases.title: Dashboard Interface
use_cases.description: Create a data-dense dashboard with a clear aesthetic point-of-view that makes information engaging rather than overwhelming
use_cases.target_user: Product teams building analytics, admin panels, or data visualization tools

use_cases.title: Interactive Web Experience
use_cases.description: Build immersive, scroll-triggered experiences with orchestrated animations and atmospheric visual effects
use_cases.target_user: Digital agencies and brands creating campaign microsites or interactive storytelling

prompt_templates.title: Landing Page with Aesthetic Direction
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a landing page for [product/service] targeting [audience]. Go for a [brutally minimal/maximalist/retro-futuristic/etc.] aesthetic. The key thing people should remember is [unique element].
prompt_templates.scenario: When you want a distinctive landing page with a specific aesthetic vision

prompt_templates.title: Component with Context
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a [component type] for a [industry/context] application. The tone should be [luxury/playful/brutalist/etc.]. Technical constraints: [React/Vue/vanilla JS], [performance requirements].
prompt_templates.scenario: When creating individual components with clear context and constraints

prompt_templates.title: Full Application Interface
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a complete interface for [application type] used by [user type]. Purpose: [problem it solves]. Make it unforgettable through [specific aspect]. Use [framework].
prompt_templates.scenario: When building complete application UIs with end-to-end design

prompt_templates.title: Redesign with Fresh Aesthetic
prompt_templates.prompt: Redesign this [existing component/page] to avoid generic AI aesthetics. Current version feels [problem]. Transform it with a [aesthetic direction] approach that emphasizes [specific quality].
prompt_templates.scenario: When refreshing existing designs that feel generic or uninspired

output_examples.input: Create a minimalist portfolio page for a photographer with a brutalist aesthetic
output_examples.output: Production-ready HTML/CSS with stark black and white design, bold condensed typography (e.g., Druk or Helvetica Now Display), asymmetric grid layouts, high-contrast image presentation, CSS-only hover effects revealing image metadata, generous whitespace, and intentional raw edges

output_examples.input: Build a maximalist dashboard for a music streaming app targeting Gen Z
output_examples.output: React components with vibrant gradient meshes, playful rounded typography (e.g., Ginto or Roobert), overlapping layered cards, enthusiastic micro-animations using Framer Motion, custom cursor effects, noise textures, and staggered reveal animations on scroll

best_practices: Start by understanding purpose, audience, and constraints before coding
Commit to a bold, clear aesthetic direction rather than playing it safe
Choose distinctive, characterful fonts that elevate the design
Use CSS variables for cohesive color systems and theming
Focus animations on high-impact moments rather than scattered micro-interactions
Match implementation complexity to aesthetic vision (elaborate code for maximalist, precision for minimalist)
Create atmospheric depth with backgrounds, textures, and layered effects
Use unexpected layouts with asymmetry, overlap, or diagonal flow
Vary designs between projects - avoid converging on common patterns
Prioritize accessibility and performance even with bold aesthetics
anti_patterns: Using generic fonts like Inter, Roboto, Arial, or system fonts without intention
Defaulting to purple gradients on white backgrounds or other cliched color schemes
Creating cookie-cutter layouts and component patterns that lack context
Adding animations everywhere without strategic focus on key moments
Using solid color backgrounds when atmospheric depth would add more character
Playing it safe with timid, evenly-distributed color palettes
Reusing the same aesthetic approach (e.g., Space Grotesk + dark mode) across different projects
Implementing minimalist designs without attention to spacing, typography precision, and subtle details
Over-engineering simple designs or under-implementing complex aesthetic visions

faq.question: What frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill supports vanilla HTML/CSS/JS, React, Vue, and other modern frontend frameworks. Specify your technical constraints in the prompt for framework-specific implementations.

faq.question: How do I ensure the design matches my brand?
faq.answer: Provide context about your brand's purpose, audience, and desired tone. Specify an aesthetic direction (e.g., 'luxury refined' or 'playful toy-like') that aligns with your brand identity. The more context you provide, the better the design will match your needs.

faq.question: Will the generated code be accessible and performant?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill emphasizes production-grade code that considers accessibility and performance, even with bold aesthetics. However, always test with your specific requirements and users.

faq.question: What if I want a minimalist design instead of maximalist?
faq.answer: Both minimalist and maximalist approaches work - the key is intentionality. For minimalist designs, the skill will focus on precision, refined typography, careful spacing, and subtle details rather than elaborate effects.

faq.question: Can I specify exact colors or fonts to use?
faq.answer: Yes! Include specific design requirements in your prompt (e.g., 'use our brand colors: #FF6B6B and #4ECDC4' or 'must use our brand font Montserrat'). The skill will incorporate your constraints while maintaining design quality.

faq.question: How do I avoid getting similar designs each time?
faq.answer: The skill is designed to vary aesthetics between projects. To ensure diversity, specify different aesthetic directions, tones, or unique elements you want emphasized. Each project should feel contextually appropriate rather than templated.

dependencies: Node.js and npm/yarn for React/Vue projects
Optional: Framer Motion for advanced React animations
Optional: Custom font licenses for distinctive typography
